title: How to Copy a QR Code on PC or Mac

steps.title: Open the QR code you want to save.
steps.content: Open the QR code you want to save. You can screenshot and save a QR code from the web or another file on your computer.

steps.title: Press ⊞ Win+⇧ Shift+S on your keyboard.
steps.content: Press ⊞ Win + ⇧ Shift + S on your keyboard. Pressing the Windows key + Shift + S opens the built-in screenshotting tool.

steps.title: Draw a box around the QR code to trim it.
steps.content: Draw a box around the QR code to trim it. The keyboard shortcut opens the Snipping Tool to the Rectangular Selection tool. Click and drag the mouse to draw a box around the QR code—when you lift your finger from the mouse, the screenshot will be captured and copied to your clipboard. steps.title: Paste the copied QR code.
steps.content: Paste the copied QR code. You can now paste the QR code into any document, email message, or app by right-clicking a typing area and selecting Paste .

steps.title: Open the QR code you want to save.
steps.content: Open the QR code you want to save. You can screenshot and save a QR code from the web or another file on your computer.

steps.title: Press ⇧ Shift+⌘ Command+4 on your keyboard.
steps.content: Press ⇧ Shift + ⌘ Command + 4 on your keyboard. This keyboard combination will allow you to select an area on your screen and save a screenshot of the selected area to your desktop.

steps.title: Click and drag the cursor to outline the QR code.
steps.content: Click and drag the cursor to outline the QR code. This will instantly take a screenshot of the selected area and save it to your desktop as an image file. If you want to copy the image file from your desktop, Ctrl + click the file, then select Copy . You can now paste the copied QR code anywhere, such as into an email or document.
